summary: My newest Critical role fanart is a cute little Beau, I really like how she came out, the chibi art style is not one I drawn in...
caption:
My newest Critical role fanart is a cute little Beau, I really like how she came out, the chibi art style is not one I drawn in often so it was nice to see I could still do it. I’m working on jester next!

This picture is up on my Redbubble as a sticker and many other items.

blog.description: 30s, Queer (Lesbian), I love D&D; My brother got me hooked on Critical Role. I try but don't always tag spoilers so this account is not #spoilerfree

tags: it's wild to me that I can be fans of the same show as these people
because we honestly must be watching it very different ways or for different reasons
it's interesting that the morality discussion for ep 34 on tumblr was about Suggestion and Charm magic
and over on reddit they're arguing if people should be summarily executed for breaking and entering
summary: Nothing makes me more aware of how my politics affect my interpretation of storytelling than going on reddit and seeing comments...
body:
Nothing makes me more aware of how my politics affect my interpretation of storytelling than going on reddit and seeing comments along the lines of:

“Well, the M9 trespassed on a government facility so the foreman there was totally within his rights to order their execution, they’re in the wrong for trespassing. Oh, and yeah, I’m going to really downplay the enslavement of a sentient creature, that’s not as important as the fact that the M9 broke the law.”

or

“The Dwendalian Empire is well within their rights in a DnD world to outlaw the worship of certain gods, it doesn’t matter if worshiping some of them doesn’t hurt anybody, breaking the law is wrong and there should be consequences for the characters who worship illegally.”

I just….these people and I conceive of the world and morality so differently that we might as well be living in different fucking dimensions. 

I also wonder what show they’re watching because….I don’t think the narrative in CR has ever supported that type of authoritarian-centered version of morality. Jesus H., people, find some fucking nuance and stop endorsing police states as the height of moral virtue.

reblog.comment:

“Well, the M9 trespassed on a government facility so the foreman there was totally within his rights to order their execution, they’re in the wrong for trespassing. Oh, and yeah, I’m going to really downplay the enslavement of a sentient creature, that’s not as important as the fact that the M9 broke the law.”

or

“The Dwendalian Empire is well within their rights in a DnD world to outlaw the worship of certain gods, it doesn’t matter if worshiping some of them doesn’t hurt anybody, breaking the law is wrong and there should be consequences for the characters who worship illegally.”

I just….these people and I conceive of the world and morality so differently that we might as well be living in different fucking dimensions. 

I also wonder what show they’re watching because….I don’t think the narrative in CR has ever supported that type of authoritarian-centered version of morality. Jesus H., people, find some fucking nuance and stop endorsing police states as the height of moral virtue.

Nothing makes me more aware of how my politics affect my interpretation of storytelling than going on reddit and seeing comments along the lines of:

Oh, and yeah, I’m going to really downplay the enslavement of a sentient creature, that’s not as important as the fact that the M9 broke the law.”

or

“The Dwendalian Empire is well within their rights in a DnD world to outlaw the worship of certain gods, it doesn’t matter if worshiping some of them doesn’t hurt anybody, breaking the law is wrong and there should be consequences for the characters who worship illegally.”

I just….these people and I conceive of the world and morality so differently that we might as well be living in different fucking dimensions. 

I also wonder what show they’re watching because….I don’t think the narrative in CR has ever supported that type of authoritarian-centered version of morality. Jesus H., people, find some fucking nuance and stop endorsing police states as the height of moral virtue.
trail.content:
Nothing makes me more aware of how my politics affect my interpretation of storytelling than going on reddit and seeing comments along the lines of:

“Well, the M9 trespassed on a government facility so the foreman there was totally within his rights to order their execution, they’re in the wrong for trespassing. Oh, and yeah, I’m going to really downplay the enslavement of a sentient creature, that’s not as important as the fact that the M9 broke the law.”

or

“The Dwendalian Empire is well within their rights in a DnD world to outlaw the worship of certain gods, it doesn’t matter if worshiping some of them doesn’t hurt anybody, breaking the law is wrong and there should be consequences for the characters who worship illegally.”

I just….these people and I conceive of the world and morality so differently that we might as well be living in different fucking dimensions. 

I also wonder what show they’re watching because….I don’t think the narrative in CR has ever supported that type of authoritarian-centered version of morality. Jesus H., people, find some fucking nuance and stop endorsing police states as the height of moral virtue.

summary: So, in tje campaign wrap up of campaign 1, the campaign was divided into arcs.In which arc would you say are we currently in...
question: So, in tje campaign wrap up of campaign 1, the campaign was divided into arcs.In which arc would you say are we currently in campaign two?
answer: ohhh boy that’s a really good question! I think we might be right at the start of Arc 3? I’d say getting the gang together and travelling to Zadash would be Arc 1; getting famous in Zadash, the war, going to Labenda/Shady Creek and dealing with the Shepherds (and all that craziness) and then back to Zadash again would be 2; and now we’ve begun the dive into Jester and Fjord’s backstories and the m9′s misadventures along the coast in Arc 3, which I absolutely am ADORING right now ᕕ( ᐛ )ᕗ

blog.name: dr-archeville
blog.title: Doktor Archeville's Laboratory
blog.description:
Hi!  I am a fat 40-something white introvert in NC.  I worked in the NCSU Libraries for 13 years, then was an insurance agent working with Aflac (quack!) for about 9 months, and currently work as a substitute teacher in Roxboro & a repairer/maintainer of sewing machines out of my home.
My preferred pronouns are he/him/his; my preferred nicknames are Doc or Dok, or Science Squid (or Jon).

I am a fan of... things.  So many things.
* Comics (DC Comics, Marvel Comics)
* Tabletop RPGs (Dungeons & Dragons/D&D/DnD, Eclipse Phase, GURPS, Pathfinder, Shadowrun, World of Darkness) (My OCs, my games)
* Video Games (Elder Scrolls series, Fallout series, Minecraft)
* Podcasts (Binging with Babish, Critical Role)
* Webcomics (Order of the Stick, Oglaf, SMBC, Schlock Mercenary, xkcd)
* Geek Culture /  Geek Life /  Misc. Geekery (including memes)

Basically, if it's got cosplay, fantasy, horror (esp. body horror and zombies), science (or SCIENCE!) & sci-fi, steampunk, or superheroes (or supervillains), I'll probably love it.

I also try to keep up with actual science and technology, especially body modification and transhumanism.
I also blog about libraries and library- & librarian-related things (including books), in part because I'd worked in a library for thirteen years, and about education (especially education in NC and education in America) due to my work in academic libraries and as a substitute teacher.  And about language and linguistics, as those fascinate me.
Also about jobs and job hunting, since I've been unemployed or underemployed for an uncomfortably long time, and we could all use a little help there.
I also enjoy cooking (and food), which is a type of science.  Here are some recipes I've collected.

This being the internet, I also reblog posts with cute animals.  I'm especially fond of bats.  And squid, cuttlefish, and other cephalopods. While I'm listing animals, I may as well provide a link to my cat posts.  It is the internet, so there are a lot of them.

I'm a big fan of/believer in people being themselves, and of consenting adults being able to do whatever they want however they want with whoever they want, no matter what others think.  (I.e., body positivity, sex positivity).  I try to keep this blog SFW -- the only porn I'll be posting here are food porn and technology porn -- but I do sometimes talk about sex (esp. sex education) and burlesque (there are some great burly troupes in the Triangle & Triad area).

I struggle with mild depression and anxiety issues, so sometimes my blog may get a bit maudlin.  But I also try to give advice on dealing with those, too.
-----------------------
Things I've Liked (Note: May contain some NSFW posts)
My Tumblr Crushes
My personal blargings
About Me / It Me
Getting To Know Me
My TMI Tuesday blargings
My Feels

Conventions!
* Animazement
* ConCarolinas
* ConTemporal
* Cosplay America
* Dragon*Con / Dragon Con

My Face
My Facebook
Art-related blargings
Music-related blargings
Most Fridays nights I’m at the Retro Film shows at the the Carolina Theatre in Durham.  Come join me!

tags: source: how i met your mother
summary:
Jester: Caleb, what’s wrong?
Caleb: It’s nothing.
Jester: Just tell me.
Caleb: Why do you need to know so bad?
Jester: So I can...
body:
Jester: Caleb, what’s wrong?
Caleb: It’s nothing.
Jester: Just tell me.
Caleb: Why do you need to know so bad?
Jester: So I can cheer you up!
Caleb: It’s not your job to cheer me up.
Jester: Yes, it is. Cheering you up is my job!
Caleb: Well then, you’re fired.
Jester: You can’t fire me. I’m union, bitch.

dialogue.name: Caleb
dialogue.label: Caleb:
dialogue.phrase: Why do you need to know so bad?

dialogue.name: Jester
dialogue.label: Jester:
dialogue.phrase: So I can cheer you up!
